title: The Saffron Signature
premise: A disgraced food critic, now a reluctant consultant for the police, discovers a serial killer is targeting the world's most elite chefs, leaving behind a single, perfect dish at each crime scene—a dish that reveals the victim's deepest culinary shame. To catch the killer, she must deconstruct the recipes, which are cryptic clues to both the murderer's identity and the next target, all while her own past as a ruthless critic makes her a potential victim.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a former celebrity food critic with a hyper-developed palate and a reputation for destroying careers, now working in obscurity.
conflict: Elara must race against time to solve the culinary puzzles left by a killer who believes he is 'purifying' the gastronomic world, all while confronting the damage her own critiques may have caused and evading a police detective who suspects her involvement.
setting: Present-day, alternating between the high-pressure, glittering world of international fine dining capitals (New York, Paris, Tokyo) and the gritty underbelly of their kitchen scenes.
tone: Atmospheric and suspenseful, with a gourmet's sensory detail and the creeping dread of a psychological thriller.
